content: simple garter stitch stripes make the perfect companion for cozy moments by the fire just add s mores for the ultimate in camping enjoyment **measurements ** 61 /155 cm long and 39 /99 cm wide after blocking **yarn ** brooklyn tweed dapple dk weight 60% merino wool/40% organic cotton 165 yards/150 meters per 50g skein two strands of the same colorway are held together throughout the pattern an approximate total of 4 000 yards in the following colorways canopy c1 396 yds/3 skeins anchor c2 1 010 yds/7 skeins blueprint c3 528 yds/4 skeins cosmos c4 528 yds/4 skeins plinth c5 340 yds/3 skeins cerise c6 340 yds/3 skeins honeycrisp c7 264 yds/2 skeins medallion c8 198 yds/2 skeins seafoam c9 396 yds/3 skeins feel free to substitute yarn a note on finding alternates is included in the pattern **needles ** us 9 5 5mm 40 circular needles or size needed to obtain gauge the length of the cord is not crucial so long as the full 39 width of the blanket can fit comfortably on the circulars **tools ** tapestry needle to weave in ends **skill level ** beginner **skills required ** long tail cast on icelandic bind off optional **show off your work ** use the hashtag #thebestcampfireblanket on social media to share your progress
